intro: Coleosanthus mohavensis, commonly known as the Mohave candelabra, is a rare and striking plant native to the Mojave Desert. It is a flowering plant in the family Amaryllidaceae, characterized by its tall, branching stems and clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. It produces small, round berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and specific environmental requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
